It's simmular looking to small EXO-FORCE battle machines.
The green is cool along with boulderax, the rock monster.
Pros:

dynamite!
rock monster,boulderax
robot vehicle
energy crystals

Cons:

author: just2good
title: Got it yesterday (friday), fun and not bad!
review:
I thought this set would stink. But I got it and its awsome! 
Pros:
Rock Monster
Miner
TNT
Crystal
Machine
Claw!
Changeable Face
Cons:

One of the stickers feels like sand paper. O.o

author: Takeshi
title: The monsters are attacking! Deploy Mine Mechs!
review:
This set seems to be a slight copy of some of the Exo-Force battle machines, but it still maintains it's individuality. It comes with the Mine Mech, Boulderax rock monster, and 1 dark green energy crystal.

Mine Mech
Pros: Plenty of articulated joints, so lot's of poseability. Comes with new roll cage piece, and a dynamite piece. The claw functions quite well, allowing you to capture Bouldrax. The drill piece is quite similar to the one used in the Aquaraiders 7771 Lobster Strike, but is still cool. It also has some textured stickers that glow in the dark!

Cons: Besides a strange appearance, none!

Bouldrax
Pros: He has poseable arms, and can hold up to two ernergy crystals in his mouth at a time. Or a piece of dynamite...

Cons: His legs don't move, and he is smaller than anticipated.

Summary: I reccomend this set, especially if you have the stone chopper and can make the combo model!

author: dragon_teenager
title: A good way to sample the Power Miners theme for cheap.
review:
This set is not great, but it is good. It comes with valuable new Power Miners elements, including a rollcage, TNT, some trans elements, an awesome minifigure and a rock monster. All of these parts are great and this set can make a wonderful parts pack. The mech itself, however, is passable if lacking. The main body is cleverly built and very cleanly designed. The limbs, however, are rubbish. The legs are too blocky and the tools are too bare.

I would get this set for one of two reasons:

- To sample the new Power Miners elements and minifigures
- To collect the entire theme

This set doesn't hold up very well on it's own. If you're a collector, get it- if you're just trying out the theme, get it- but the more expensive sets are definitely better than this.

author: spencey1980
title: SWEET
review: sweet & awesome.I  anticipated  it so much that i would go on the computer just to see it.And begged my mom to go to toys"r"us for a week before I bought it.4 STARS!! i have really nothing else to say.

author: legoboy545
title: cool+cool=awsome
review:
this set is so cool i got it at toys r us alonge with the
granite grinder
thunder driller
chrystal sweeper

on2 the pros/cons
pros:
boulderex
fig.
cristal
TNT
mech itself

SHORTER THEN IT LOOKS.
over all 4/5

L8tr

author: David1971
title: Nice greens
review:
I had a curious experience with this set: I saw it already built in the shop window (Dominoes in Leicester, UK – turns out to be an excellent shop for Lego, with the whole new 2009 range on display). It didn’t look very appealing really – none of the Power Miners sets looked very amazing. But I wanted to try a Power Miners set so I got this one. And the curious experience is that, through building it, I came to quite like it. I am assuming this is a phenomenon that applies to Lego in general – you get more of a feel for a thing when you’ve built it yourself and appreciated how it’s all done. (Indeed, this would apply more to other, larger, cleverer sets, where there is better engineering and use of parts to be admired). Lego sets always seem much better when you’ve built them, compared to what you see in the photos (even though the box photos are always nicely done) and I guess this is why.

Anyway, this set is, actually, not amazing, but is a fine little set. The lime green parts are really nice … it’s a good colour. The minifig has a strange face … the eyes are especially weird … maybe this is explained in the Power Miners backstory, or whatever, but basically it’s not a great face. But this walker-thing is quite good overall and you can possibly re-enact the climax of the movie Aliens with it.

author: MrHeadache
title: A very good set.
review: The set includes the robot with Brains and Boulderax with a crystal. Brians has a cool face, but it's two-sided, so I can't really use it much. The rock monster (Boulderax) is awesome, but even though I WAS expecting him to be small, I was surprised at how small he is. You can grab the monster in the claw. The set includes dynamite and a pickaxe for if the mech breaks down.  There isn't much bad to say about this set, so 5/5.

author: andy87
title: Its like rock raiders all over again
review:
when i saw this at toys r us, i was shocked. I was like "didn't they have a theme like this about 10 years ago?" I had this together in about 5 minutes (because i was really eager to build the other set i bought, the mars mission ultra drill walker). 

Anyway, the little rock monster is pretty enjoyable. He can eat the green crystal. But he is really small, and doesn't pose as much of a threat if you ask me. (He's even smaller then the included miner)

The mine mech is pretty cool. I love the minifgure, he has 2 faces, one smiling and one shocked and angry. The actual mining mech looks kinda thrown together, and is pretty short (The picture makes it look way taller then it actually is) But it does have a drill and claws and dynomite!

i give it 8/10

author: MasterBuilder
title: omp chomp chomp
review: The Mine Mech is an ok set but has some flaws/stuff I don't like. First of all, the driver Doc or whatever his name is cannot stand up in the roll cage whereas on the other vehicles most can. The rock monsters like Boulderax are a lot smaller than they look, and can fit crystals in their mouths. I actually managed to stuff 2 in them, and at least 4 with their mouths opened. Bad sticker placement on the robot thing, and the claws and drill are a little weird. They cannot grip anything really easily, and I cannot find any real use for them.

author: captain_radda_radda
title: I changed my mind
review:
I was sooo happy and positive on my review on the stone chopper. Then I got this. I saw it at wal-mart as my second power miners set. My mom bought it for my and boy, I was so dissapointed. If I had any money, I would definately pay my mom back. I should have got the assasin speeder instead. 

Pros:
Rock monster
Miner
Dynamite

Cons:
flimsy
Either green or gray but not both
cheap chage cover thing
the claw sticks out too much
looks like its missing something
legs are too bulky
seems hunched over to me

Overall:I have given up on power miners because of this set. It was a dissapointment. I dont under stand how this set got so many 5s.

author: jjr
title: miners fun
review:
again I was bored and wanted to spend some money. and I saw this nice little set in the shelves, so I decided to buy this as a expirimetal set (when a theme is new I always buy first a small set to get the feel of the theme) and I was impresed. the green and orange didn't apeal me, but after I bought this.. well. it looks very good. the playability is also good, however I would like to see a rock monster with moving legs. 

playability: 8
build: 7
value for the money: 6 (9 euro a little expensive)

overal a really good set,

author: IlovePowerMiners
title: Bzzzt! Bzzzt! Raaaawrr!
review:
O.K., the "Bzzzts" are moving legs of the Mine Mech. The "Raaaawrr" is Boulderax. I know a lot of people like to buy a small set to test out the series before they buy a large one from the series. Let me tell you this is the perfect starter set, especially better than the Stone Chopper. The set has moveable legs, Boulderax, pickax, dynamite, and Brains. Lets get on to the pros and cons.

Pros: moveable legs & arms
         Boulderax
         Brains
         Big crystal
         Pickax & dynamite

Cons: NONE!


                                    Buy it!

author: JBH75
title: Go green!! Now!!
review:
This the 2nd power miner set I got. It's really cool. You can slice Boulderax with the saw, carry him in claw and get the green crystal. You can even pose the mine mech to show that he won!!

Here's a pro/con list!

Pros:
Green Crystal
Dynamite, and Pickaxe
Roll cage (cool new accessory)
Textured glow-in-the dark stickers (I usually hate stickers)
Boulderax

Cons:
Short legs (I make mine stand up by putting the legs straight up to the side in an "I" shape, rather than the L shape)
Kinda short arms (I swapped my mech's arms for the old Lewa Nuva's arms)

This set is great set, and if you do get it, you won't be disappointed. You can follow my tips and change the arms and the legs, but that's just my design opinion. Do want you want with yours!!

author: StormSworder
title: Ugh!
review: When I first saw this I wasn't even sure it was Lego.  It looks like the kind of cheap plastic sci-fi toy you usually find in jumble sales.  The colours are absolutely hideous (whoever came up with lime-green coupled wth bright orange should be shot) and it all looks very tacky.  The rock-person (?) is just another example of how Lego's non-licenced sci-fi sets have changed from imaginative visions of the future to low-budget cartoons or naff b-movies.  Save your money up and get some (far superior) Rock Raiders sets, or if you want a walker-type vehicle then Blacktron and Classic Space had some much better ones.

author: Legoman1993
title: Not bad for a $10.00 set!
review:
This is my second power miners review. I think this set is ok for its price! TLC finally came up with more smaller sets instead of $6.99 than all of the sudden the next set is $15.00 They changed their price pattern a little! I'm glad they did that! TLC needed smaller sets anyways just like the early 2000"s I think the Mine Mec is a pretty decent set,

The machine: First off I like the new black cage piece! The claw is an okay  
feature , although it is somewhat hard to grab anything with! Nice orange colour though! You can grab the rock monster"s feet with it and you won't have any trouble:] The legs are not as good as i thought they would be! The legs are difflcult to make them walk:[ So I put mine straight so it can walk in my case. The cutter works great! It can spin really well if you loosen the pieces a bit. The stick of dynatine is a awesome piece to have, instead of the tile ones we used to have in rock raiders time. 

The mini fig: The mini figure that comes with it is  a good designed! I like the mini fig head! It looks like a professer or a chemist! Cool torso piece, that is coloured blue with a potion symbol on it.  
 
The rock monster: Interesting piece I have ever saw. The arms move and the mouth piece as well.That is a great feature to add on the new rock monsters. Very interesting colour neon green! You can also place a crystal inside him!    
      Overall  rating 3.8/5 If you like power miners or rock raiders buy it! everyone esle maybe not...

author: knuclear200x
title: Not that great on its own, but good to have.
review:
By just looking at the box, you probably noticed how unappealing it almost looks.

That claw looks kind of loose. And how does that buzzsaw look cool frontways instead of sideways? And what small feet you have. But the rest of it looks all right. You have those tight ball joints that are more poseable than the joints used in the Exo-Force/Lego Knights Kingdom line.

Anyway I bought this since I just really needed another robot, as well as some of useful pieces that go with it. Maybe do a little army-building...

Cons: 
The arms (in box art and instructions) look like they're backwards. They're also kind of short. The buzzsaw can be rotated but it really would have looked better facing sideways. The claw hand, to my surprise, isn't loose and can hold pretty much anything. But the "one pincer over the other" design doesn't really work that well in my opinion. And then there are the legs. The instructions don't really instruct a good idea, as they look froggy and the thighs don't seem too poseable.

Fixes:
Instead of having the thighs' (green plates) facing forward, better to just turn it to the side and they'll be more poseable. The knees/shins 90* angle should be 180*'d for the same reason, and the arms should be 180*'d too, as they'll look better (or more natural, if you will). If you're unsatisfied by the claw as I was, you can disassemble it and insert the cross-pegs into one arm's cross-holes for a better looking, though unposeable, claw. Or make scythe-arms by putting one pincer on each arm.

As for the other arm, the remaining pieces give you very little options. A few things I can think of, are connecting the green "Axle-joiner" with the black cross-piece on to the arm so that it ALMOST looks like a gun, or stick in the pick-axe to make it a uh... a pick-axe arm with a short reach. Another nice thing to do is to turn the arms and legs around, stick one pincer on each arm and have the mini-fig stand on the two open pegs (between the levers) to make a neat, little "four-legged walker".

If these don't do it for you, then pull out your bucket of extra pieces and go crazy.

Pros:
The cockpit flips open, and its unique to see that the machine levers are behind the pilot instead of in front.

Conclusion:
If you're going to buy this small set, you should have other pieces at your disposal to make it better, like making the feet bigger or the arms longer basically. Or expect very little of it otherwise. Either way, the set can be slightly improved with a few things not limited to what was mentioned above. 

It is a nice little set worth $8, but you may want to buy another set along with it, like the Stone Chopper, for extra fun. But whether bought alone or not, you won't regret it too much.

author: hustla187
title: Weak Walker
review: For ten dollars, you get some cheesy walker from a theme that was a ripoff of another theme.  I don't like the orange hands which makes this set stupid and the rock monster should actually be bigger. The legs aren't bad but not the best. Overall, you really shouldn't get this set.

author: jack75
title: Did anyone else get a different copy???
review:
I got a unique copy of this set today. I actually got a neon green crystal instead of plain green. To the pros and cons!

author: icemon300
title: Amazing Mech!
review: This is one cool set! Even if it wasn't too great for $13, it is still really nice. With a resemblance to an Exo-Force machine, it is very playable. Oh, the crystal is an interesting shade of trans-green, just like the rock monster. The set is the same size as the picture shows, including the Rock Monster. The drill can spin and the claw can move around. Includes Brains the scientist and Bolderax (green rock monster).

author: Jakelegofilms
title: Cool Machine and Monster!
review: The Mine Mech and Stone Chopper were my first Power Miner sets.  I really like the spinning claw! The pinching claw is great for attacking Boulderax. It came with dynamite that I had never seen before with other lego sets. This set made me want to collect all of the rest, everybody should get one!

author: Bricknave
title: Exo-Force + Rock Raiders + lime green = This
review:
The Mine Mech is a nice little Exo-Force-like easy to build set.

Pros:
Lime green bricks.
Orange blades are a must have for Bionicle fans.
Transparent orange light brick.
Exo-Force joints.

Cons:
The buzz-saw arm is fine, but the claw arm is ... weird.
Pick-axe gets in the way of the legs.

4/5

~Bricknave

author: penguin999
title: one of the best sets ever!
review:
This set is sooooooooo cool. This set includes Brains (the smart miner) and boulderex (the strong but dumb rock monster) with crystal. The mine mech is like robotic suit to make a super soldier. The interior is small (1minifig max) . The pilot has to sit down to drive the walker. In it , it has 2 levers to pilot it and next to it has TNT and a pickax (it also has a signal bulb on top of the roll cage). The weapons are, a plasma saw to cut through solid objects like rock and a giant claw to grab objects like people and to snip objects in half. And last but not least the feet , for stomping on and crunching on enemy's or objects to destroy them (also they don't always stand up straight, especially on carpet) I also switched the claw and the saw because the claw feels comfortable on the right. Time for pros and cons

pros:brains
       boulderex
       claw
       saw
       TNT
       
cons:feet are a little stubby
        stickers.....again

author: Kalhiki
title: Excellent Mech
review:
My first Power Miners set and now I'm finally getting around to a review. Let's start with the minifigs.
Brains: Tis the scientist he is. And you can tell. On the back of his shirt (or body) he has the saw with a test tube symbol. I've noticed these symols are different depending on the character. The front of his body shows blue suspeders and a white, long-sleeve undershirt. And in his pockets he has what appears to be test tubes. His pants are just like everyone else's: A chain and a flashlight painted on. His head shows grey eyebrows and mustache. He also has an odd eyepiece (For close inspections I suppose.) And he has the helmet that everone else has.
Boulderax: Average rock monster in only in dark green and also comes with a crystal in the same color.  But he's special. This is the ONLY set you can get him in so far if I'm not mistaken. Also a warning for vigorous Lego players. The grey on the rock monsters is just painted on and can chip off. Carefull!
Now onto the Mine Mech. This is actually pretty good. But like most power miners sets, a little small for the price. From the bottom up: The feet include the glow-in-the-dark stickers like all of the sets. Not much else, but the are very stable on the ground. Also not much on the legs except the stickers on the "knees' of it. Nice detail on those.
The Body has the rollcage with a ligh on it (barraki eye piece if your a bionicle fan.) And it has the 2 on the front meaning it's #2 on the first wave size scale. It has holders for the dynamite and pickaxe, along with two levers for the vehicle controls.
On one arm has the "function" where one spins the gear on the back and it spins the orange saw. Not really a function. The other arm has the claw which, sadly, doesn't realy pick up anything that well. The arms are short limiting the range of posability.
Overall a nice set. Highly recommended. Pick it up if you have some cash to spend.

author: C_Fish
title: Look out, Rock Monsters!
review:
I like this set.
Pros:
Bionicle parts work well.
Dynamite.
Rock Monster
Good Playabilaty.
Cool spinning blade and grabbing claws.

Cons:
Feels weak. 
The part with the number sticker on tend to fall off.
Brains has 2-sided head. :(

This is overall a good set.

review:

review:

         cool design
         boulderax (the only set hes in)

          double face

           overall 7/10

author: Speninator
title: move a leg...break.drop it... break.light dynamite...break
review: This is a nifty little exploration device, that brains can use to scale cliffs or to fend off monsters and drill walls. yet however, there is one major flaw. This thing is better to be posed than played with. It will break with a slight touch and isn't very fun to just look at. Not only that, but it will be impossible to rebuild without instructions, it has many loose parts, yet it can increase your power miners' collection. The best part is boulderax, and the dynamite to blow him up.

author: TransformR
title: What is up with the claw arm?
review:
This set is quite... different.
Now on to the review
Pros:
Only set with Boulderax!
Saw works well
Dynamite and Pickaxe storage on sides
Cons:
Claw arm looks wierd.
Brains(Miner) is dificult to put inside

In my opinion this is a very strange, different set.
But worth buying!

author: davy_jones
title: Engineering protoype
review:
I call this review 'engineering prototype' because the mech resembles one. The design is a mishmash of various elements required to meet certain engineering demands as per the storyline. So the end result can be justified using the function over form reason.
   The rock monsters are charismatic little fellas and I love them in both sets that I have. But I still cant fathom the fact that the humans need such complex machines to deal with the small, feisty looking creatures. Aww come on, where's the spirit of peace?

The good:
The set gets a 4 because of Mr. Rock Monster and the various engineering appendages.

The bad:
It doesnt get a 5 because the design is akward.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: Nice model...
review:
The Mine Mech set (8957) is a LEGO Power Miners set which came out in 2009. It comes with 2 minifigs and 67 pieces. This set does include a few decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8957-1.jpg[/img]


Minifigures:

  • Brians: Brians comes with a blue helmet, with printed legs and a double-sided head and torso. His arms are printed white. 
  • Boulderax: Boulderax is the green monster in the Power Miners theme. His mouth does open and you can put in the transparent green crystal which comes with this set. He also has some cool markings on his head. The whole monster minifig comes with an extra bag.
Mine Mech:

The Mine Mech is very easy to build. The arms, the legs and the feet of the mech are movable and one arm comes with a claw. The other arm has a driller which spins full 360°. On the one side you can see a stick of dynamite and on the other side you can see a pickax. On the top of the cockpit you can see a light and you can open this cockpit. You'll see the controls and the place for the minifig.


Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Nice starter set
Minifigures
Crystal

Negative:

Not so many play features
Too easy to build

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1
Stopmotion 2
Review

author: Darthleapyous
title: good for your pm collection
review:
i got this today, because i get prezies on new years. I built it straight away.I now have a small collection.I got it with crystal king (which i will do a review on tomorow).

grabbing claw
blade
brains

overall:

author: BIONICLEGuy
title: YOU'RE GONNA FALL OUT BRAINS!
review:
Okay then, this is a great set.
I've always liked twenty-first century LEGO mechs, and I love this!
But there are still problems.

Pros- 
Cool model.
Cool rock monster.
Cool miner.
The arms and legs take no time at all!
Rare pieces.

Cons-
Brains can't attach to the Mine Mech that easily.
Once you DO get Brains attached, the cockpit takes him off again!
Apart from the arms and legs, this set is pretty hard to build.

author: r2d2qa
title: Great!
review:
The first time you look at a LEGO Power Miners set you think " this look so childish. " but never trust the box. I got this from my parents on my sister's birthday (my sister gets something little on my birthday and get something little on hers) it looked more  kids from the age of 4-6 but when i opened it up and built it was (same thing what i said on the title.) i'll make a pro and con list to show you well... the pros and cons:)

Pros:
- the Brains minifigure has a double sided head and well... he's the Brains!!
- Only set where you could get the Boulderax figure.
-        Dark Green Gem. (I like green.)
-        Pick Axe and Dynamite. (MhwuuuuHaaHaaHaaHaa...Haa)
-        Orange and green color scheme.
-       Mech has Saw Hand and Claw hand. 
-       The Price is reasonable.
-      Can be combined with set 8956 Stone Chopper to make a pretty cool vehicle.

Cons: 
- Mech has short arms and stubby legs. 
-         Bottom of the Mech's feet don't connect to LEGO Bricks.
-         The Claw is kinda bad because both of the blades don't touch each other. 
-         The Saw arm is longer than the Claw one.
-         I don't like where the dynamite and pickaxe are stored on the Mech.
-         the little Trans Orange thing on the very top of the Mech (is it a light?) isn't good because it's short and can't be put in the middle of Mech, but that's not much of a problem.

In the end, it a cheap set that if nothing else interest you, you should buy it.
it's also good starting set if you want to start collecting Power Miner LEGO sets.

author: Legojii
title: Good but left wanting
review:
I must say quite a nice build, challenging but rewarding. the fig looks out of place though, it would have been better as a driver than a scientist 

As constructs go its a bit small but packed with good stuff, love the claws love the saw.the rock elemental fig is nice, i see some elemental campains in the future for my gaming buddies. I added some pieces from my creator set to make it taller and i liked it better. 

Overall im happy with it, it could be better but its ok as a starter.

Pros

  • -it is a good way to start on a set and also one looking to make small industrial mech designs 
  • -the balance is well done, not too top heavy and has a lot of charm to the build  

Cons

  • -i dont like stickers
  • -the prof seemed out of place here. 

due to this set i began collecting LEGO again. for good or for ill this will be my hobby and i love it

author: LEGOwikiguy
title: Can't stomp on the rock monster with this one...
review:
Ok, one thing: THE LEGS ARE SMALLER THAN THEY LOOK IN THE PICTURE!

Now that that is off my chest, I can tell you the rest. I got this for the reasonable price it is sold for (about $8 USD), and comes with Boulderax (Exclusive rock monster to this set) and my favorite Power Miner, Brains. Pros and Cons incoming...

Pros: 
1. Great figures included
2. The claw is actually good for holding the Monster or the crystal
3. Pick ax to fight off Boulderax
4. Pretty flexible

Cons:
1. It's kind of tiny
2. Like said before, the light should be in the center, not on the side
3. Sometimes, the top that opens and closes breaks off (Hard to fix)

Parents: If you think you won't have to help your child with this set, you may be wrong. If they are used to Bionicle part, they probably won't need help. HOWEVER, the legs and arms are a little hard to build for a kid under 8 years of age. When finished, though, it will be very flexible.

I do recommend this set to fans of Power Miners, especially those who are used to building Bionicle sets.

author: TheFadedTBCap
title: Attack of the Mine Mech
review:
The "Mine Mech" is a neat Power Miner vehicles.  It is definetly not my favorite set, but it is a cool set to have none the less.

Pros:

- Only set with Boulderox and green crystal
- Saw blade arm is easy to spin
- Comes with pick ax and dynamite
- Claw is cool

Cons:

- Thing that holds supplies is very fragile
- Claw does look funny
- Brains is hard to get in the seat

The only major problem is the fragile supply holder.  The other two "cons" are just minor things that wouldn't bother most people.

author: EtudeTheBadger
title: Get away from her, you *****!
review:
I must say, I had been waiting quite some time for a functional mech-powerloader vehicle from LEGO. The diving suits in Alpha Team were cool but didn't have the functionality of something you'd see Ellen Ripley piloting. Exo-Force was lame, too.

'Well,' I said to myself, 'just be patient!'

My wait was satisfied in 2009 with this, the second smallest of the Power Miners sets, and one of the finest.

It's easy to build, with mostly blocky parts and BIONICLE joints and sockets thrown together with flair. BIONICLE claws comprise the gription clamp, while an Alpha Team-esque sawblade fits onto the starboard arm to chop at rock. Brains the scientist mans this thing, and Boulderax the monster is out to impede the mission. A rotating light is fitted to the rollcage, evoking scenes from Aliens.

One of this set's best features is the dark green emerald Crystal, which is unique. This sole green Crystal is the only one of its kind in the theme so far, and I love it. Boulderax is also unique, a trait shared with Firox.

This is also one of those rare sets where the stickers aren't too much of a hindrance. They are easy to fit and look super.

  • Pros:
  • Easy to build
  • Brains comes with the set
  • Unique emerald Crystal!
  • Boulderax
  • Cons:
  • None really evident
  • Maybe a little flimsy in places
Get the Crystal King and do a fight scene! Maybe get a look at Aliens for inspiration!

title: I am not making reviews daily anymore

author: roborovskilego
title: This is Small But Worth it!
review:
This set is small in all, but if you spend time with it long enough, You'll realize size isn't the only thing that matters here. A small Lego set is better than nothing right? By the way it'll probably be better than you expect so I would recommend this to all power miners fans.

Building Experience - I thought I had a great time building this. The only part that is really hard are those sphere shaped parts you have to snap in. This might need parent help. In the end though, your mine mech will move better than any set you ever dreamed of! There are other easier pieces to this set though thank goodness.

Parts - There are some pretty cool parts in here. The claw uses two cool parts that you can also find in the claw digger. There is also a wrench like piece in the back of the mine mech. This doesn't occur very much in other sets and it holds up the claw and drill. There is also the cockpit piece not in very many other themes.

Playability - Playability is one of the best parts of this set. The mine mech moves very well. His claws open and close very well. The drill also spin well too. This could probably even act out the computer generated mine mech in any of the clips. Cockpit opens and closes very nicely and it doesn't really break off. If you know I got all this playability stuff on in only a couple of minutes. I think playability is pretty awesome if I could do that!

Value for Money - The value for money is okay I'd say. To be that price it would have to have at least 100 pieces. If you need to ever know a good priced set, You should take the price and multiply it by ten. Any extra cents on the end you can just divide by ten. The price multiplied by ten should be the amount of pieces that set has. your other answer for the extra cents should be added on and the set should have at least that many pieces. How I know? The rule for price is ten cents per piece.

Overall Rating - Here it comes the overall rating! I would give it a five star rating! The only thing I thought that wasn't such a good deal was the price but that was still four stars! Everything else was five so that rating is almost unbeatable! I hope that this review was helpful because I don't want to be posting junk!

author: Uno_Brick
title: The Mine Mech
review:
This set is average. Building techniques are rather interesting, with many of the sections being placed sideways. The mech itself has a rather bulky look to it but has a good amount of lime green.

PROS:
-One minifigure (Brains, with nice printing on all parts except for arms and helmet) and green rock monster with crystal
-nice parts assortment some of which are rather large
-can be posed in many ways
-two simple mechanisms (drill and claw)
-many parts in lime green and orange.

CONS:
-contains stickers
-has a rather bulky feel
-not much playability, unless the parts are rearranged
-mechanisms(excluding posing) are simple but not very attratcive

This set is nice if you want to expand your Power Miners collection, and has a good deal of lime and orange, but when it comes to playability, this set is on the downside.

author: LobsterWarrior
title: Heh Heh, Boulderax.....
review:
This set, in my opinion, is awesome! Comes with Boulderax and Brains! The set rarely falls apart and the arms are cool because you can move them into any direction. Unfortunatley, it only has ONE crystal. 

Pros

  • -Boulderax
  • -Brains
  • -Gear
  • -Mine Mech
Cons
  • None!

I recommend this set to everyone!

author: Odeinoichus
title: Boulderax is Hungry
review:
Set 8957 Mine Mech: My first exposure to the new dynamite piece was with this set, and for that alone I would really dig the little mech, but there is so much more going for this set.

 

First of all the titular Mine Mech is a fun little vehicle to build. It uses some familiar pieces to bring together the look and feel of a heavy duty excavation tool, and if the mech has trouble breaking through the solid rock with the saw blade on its right arm the pickaxe included might just help out. (You have to make a spot to place the dynamite before blowing the granite walls open to reveal those beautiful shiny power crystals.)

 

Boulderax is a fun little Mini-Figure too, although all of the rock creatures share the same basic body the different colors are what really make each one worth having. Buying the cheaper sets to score a few of these nifty looking creatures for your Mini-Figure displays ain't too shaby.

 

A unique feature of most of the first run Power Miners sets is the ability to take the pieces of two sets and combine them (using instructions from LEGO's online site) to create even zanier looking vehicles. A feature I haven't tried out yet, but one that really adds to the value of owning both sets required to build the new vheicles.

 

It takes a little work to get the Mine Mech to stand up without toppling forward, but a few moments of fiddling and the mech will stand up just fine, all in all I'd say if you like LEGO Underground themes like Rock Raiders and Power Miners than you won't be dissapointed with this set. Especially if you already have Stone Chopper to merge with into the aptly named Cave Cutter. Plus this set is a cheap way to get the new Dynamite piece for your LEGO Accessories collection.

author: legolover2001
title: ROCK MONSTER INCOMING!!
review:
This is one of the best small Power Miners sets. It has many good pieces, leg moment and of coarse a rock monster!  

Pros

  • The green rock monster.
  • Double faced figure.
  • The claws and saw.
  • The hood of the chair for the figure.

Cons

  • The beginning of the instruction is a bit fiddly.
  • Hard to stand the robot up.

Overall this is a great set but it is very hard to make the robot stand up and even harder in a running position. Rating: 4/5
